title: What's in your daily set
content:
I’m curious to see what typefaces people are using in their daily startup sets. I know it’s more interesting to take the time and experiment with different fonts for each new design project, but for many reasons, (time, budget etc.) one must rely on the tried and true methods of efficiency. I know many of these daily sets are directly applicable to the industries and clients we serve, but I’d be very interested to see what others are doing. I’ll start. Here is a sampling of what my daily set includes:  
Aachen  
Akzidenz Grotesk  
Aldus  
Bembo  
Frutiger  
Gill Sans  
Machine  
Myriad  
Perpetua  
PopplLaudatio  
Univers
author: headcase

comments.content: Recently a lot of Monaco——_and I still love it_.

Adobe Garamond  
Adobe Caslon  
Akzidenz Grotesk  
Ed  
Eureka  
Neutraface  
Sabon  
Unit

I assume we're leaving out fonts bundled with the system or Adobe CS?

The following are always installed for me and I've used each more than a few times:

[Amplitude](http://web.archive.org/web/20110603061714/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=verity.search&searchstr=Amplitude) (Amp Wide makes an excellent System font and default for Mail and iChat.)  
 [FF Legato](http://web.archive.org/web/20110603061714/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=verity.search&searchstr=FF%20Legato)  
 [MVB Verdigris](http://web.archive.org/web/20110603061714/http:/www.fontshop.com/showfont.cfm?fid=MVB.118650.0.0)  
 [Vista Sans](http://web.archive.org/web/20110603061714/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=verity.search&searchstr=vista%20sans)  
 [Knockout](http://web.archive.org/web/20110603061714/http:/www.typography.com/catalog/knockout/index.html)  
 [FF Olsen](http://web.archive.org/web/20110603061714/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=verity.search&searchstr=FF%20Olsen)  
 [PMN Caecilia](http://web.archive.org/web/20110603061714/http:/www.fontshop.com/showfont.cfm?fid=LH.120977.0.0)  
 [FF Maiola](http://web.archive.org/web/20110603061714/http:/www.fontshop.com/showfont.cfm?fid=FF.11516.0.0)  
 [Freight](http://web.archive.org/web/20110603061714/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=verity.search&searchstr=Freight) (suite)  
 [Imbiss](http://web.archive.org/web/20110603061714/http:/www.fountain.nu/catalogue/imbisspackage.asp) (suite)  
 [Poppi](http://web.archive.org/web/20110603061714/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=verity.search&searchstr=poppi)  
 [FF Dingbats](http://web.archive.org/web/20110603061714/http:/www.fontshop.com/showfont.cfm?fid=FF.6819.0.0)

Varies a bit, but a typical set at the moment looks like this (various clients and products). Some of them were given, i.e. I had no say in choosing them.

Freight sans + text  
Verdana  
Neo Tech (Alt)  
ITC Kabel  
Cocon  
Xxxxx Script (client's own customized font)  
Helvetica Neue  
Gill Sans  
Frutiger  
Syntax  
Myriad Pro  
Trajan

mvb verdigris  
neue helvetica  
adobe garamond  
univers (mostly condensed weights)

that's about it. i use plenty else, but this is what i use every day.
I am too typographically moody to have a set that is always loaded. That said, I do use Gotham on some internal stuff so it is usually open.

(in no particular order)

ITC Tiepolo  
Optima  
Palatino  
Albertus  
Hiroshige  
PopplLaudatio  
ITC Eras  
Lithos

(in alphabetical order)

Adobe Garamond  
Bembo Book  
Caflisch Script  
Castellar  
Dante  
Diotima and Ariadne  
Frutiger  
Gill Sans  
Neuland  
Penumbra  
Post Antiqua (usually I set this in caps only)  
Syntax

I'm with Tiffany, I go into long swoons with fonts and then deep six them for awhile. It really depends on what I'm working on.

I tend to keep Gotham open, tho, along with Thesis and Today Sans and for serifs my fallbacks lately are Adobe Garamond and Filosofia.

But I've got a bunch of stuff open right now from Tribute to Meta to Klavika, Caecilia, Requiem, Jigsaw, Dalliance, Abadi, and some weird agitated scripts I was looking at for a book cover.
